page.title: 11Education Shenley & Whaddon
page.content: Shenley & Whaddon each have their own village school which also take children from the nearby villages. Parents usually accompany thier children to school, bringing them by car or on foot. Both schools have about 50 children from 5 to 8 years old, 2 teachers and some auxiliary staff. The children are in 2 classes and enjoy the basic skills of reading, writing and mathematics as well as the creative activities: art, craft, music and drama. Both schools have a computer and large playing fields where the children make up their own games and join in organized sports & games. Shenley school has a swimming pool. In both villages the schools are a focal point for community activities. The schools with parents' help organise events: plays, fetes and bonfires in which many participate.
